hxameer on mastodon.xyz said:

This is my beef with #zulip , unlike #telegram or even #gmail it doesn't give your search within the threads

even from browser

I think this is a UX issue -- they're using the search bar in the "Recent conversations" UI, because it's the most obvious search UI, and they're missing that they could type "Î· rule" into the top search bar and get results.

This is a public Zulip instance, and I verified that after signing up:
Screenshot-2023-04-13-at-10.27.13-AM.png
Yeah, search UX is a big feature. I hope it will be a bit better in the close redesign. After that I want to do a dedicated work on that.
Yeah, I'm hoping the fact that there will alway be a visible search box in the upper right will help.

There's a few things we can tweak here that would likely be helpful in addition to making the main search input more visible:

  • The input placeholder string for that widget is "filter topics"; we might want it to be "Filter recent topics" or something, to better hint what that filter box does.
  • It's a bit unfortunate that at that width we have a common breakpoint where the search input is a full line; I don't think that's intended. With the filter widget on the same line it has much less visible precedence:

Screenshot-from-2023-04-13-16-58-58.png

The input placeholder string for that widget is "filter topics"; we might want it to be "Filter recent topics" or something, to better hint what that filter box does.

What does that box actually do? Looks like it filters streams & topics, but doesn't work for DMs? I was thinking it would make sense to label it "Filter recent conversations", but that would be more accurate if we made the DMs part work, I guess.

Yeah, I think it just filters topics. We could probably make it filter the private message conversations, but filtering just on the names of the users feels pretty limited; we don't have access to message content at all here.
Yeah, names of users and maybe the phrase "direct messages" as the equivalent of stream filtering is what I was thinking.
